title: Full Time Barista
description:
**Job Title:** Full-time Barista

**Location:** SmartWorld Coffee - 74 South St. Morristown, NJ 07960

**About Us:** Established in 2006, SmartWorld Coffee has been a beloved cornerstone of the Morristown community for 18 years. We are proud to serve high-quality coffee, delicious pastries, and a warm, welcoming atmosphere that makes our customers feel right at home. Our commitment to excellence and community spirit has made us a local favorite.

**Job Summary:** We are seeking a friendly, efficient, and passionate Barista to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a love for coffee, a knack for customer service, and the ability to work well in a fast-paced environment. As a Barista at SmartWorld Coffee, you will be responsible for crafting exceptional coffee beverages, providing top-notch customer service, and maintaining a clean and organized workspace.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Prepare and serve a variety of coffee drinks, including espresso, lattes, cappuccinos, and other specialty beverages.
* Operate coffee-making equipment, such as espresso machines, grinders, and brewers.
* Maintain a clean and organized work area, including coffee machines, counters, and seating areas.
* Provide excellent customer service, greet customers warmly, and handle transactions accurately.
* Assist with restocking and inventory management of coffee beans, milk, syrups, and other supplies.
* Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations.
* Collaborate with team members to create a positive and efficient work environment.
* Assist with the opening and closing duties as needed.
* Participate in ongoing training to stay updated on new coffee trends and techniques.

**Core Values:**

* **Contribution:** Actively contribute to the success and positive atmosphere of the coffee shop, the community, and the satisfaction of our customers.
* **Teamwork:** Work collaboratively with colleagues to maintain a supportive and efficient work environment.
* **Communication:** Maintain open and effective communication with team members and customers to ensure smooth operations and a pleasant experience.
* **Integrity:** Uphold the highest standards of honesty and integrity in all interactions and tasks.
* **Self-Starter:** Take initiative and be proactive in identifying tasks that need to be done without waiting for direction.
* **Takes Ownership:** Demonstrate responsibility and accountability for your work and the overall customer experience.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience as a barista or in a similar role is preferred but not required.
* Strong customer service skills and a friendly, outgoing personality.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Attention to detail and a passion for creating high-quality beverages.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
* Flexibility to work various shifts, including weekends and holidays.
* Basic math skills for handling transactions and making change.
* A genuine love for coffee and a desire to learn more about the craft.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive hourly wage with tips.
* Opportunities for growth and advancement within the company.
* Employee discounts on coffee and pastries.
* A supportive and fun work environment.
* Ongoing training and development in coffee preparation and customer service.

**How to Apply:** If you are passionate about coffee and excited to be a part of a long-standing community staple, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter explaining why you would be a great fit for our team to jessemundt@gmail.com or apply directly to Indeed.

Join us in continuing a tradition of excellence and community at SmartWorld Coffee, where every cup is a connection. I look forward to hearing from you!

title: RN Manger for Intake position- Full-Time- Brooklyn, NY
description:

The Intake RN Manager will be responsible for supervising, instructing, and guiding intake coordinators and auxiliary personnel in the referral intake process. This role involves designing and implementing efficient work processes to ensure seamless communication between departments, referral sources, and physicians. Play a key role in ensuring efficient referral processes that enhance patient care and satisfaction.

* **Supervision & Leadership:** Supervise, instruct, and guide intake coordinators and auxiliary personnel to ensure high-quality referral intake and follow-through.
* **Process Design & Implementation:** Develop and implement efficient work processes to facilitate sound communication between departments, referral sources, and physicians.
* **Team Management:** Provide ongoing support and guidance to the intake team, fostering a collaborative and efficient work environment.
* **Performance Monitoring:** Monitor and evaluate the performance of intake staff, ensuring compliance with organizational standards and implementing improvements as needed.
* **Communication Facilitation:** Ensure effective and timely communication between all stakeholders involved in the referral process.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:**

Minimum of 2 years of experience in a Certified Home Health Agency (CHHA) intake department.

At least 1 year of supervisory experience in a related field.

* **Technical Skills:**

Proficiency with Allscripts or similar electronic health record (EHR) systems.

* **Additional Skills:**

Strong leadership and communication skills.

Ability to design and implement efficient work processes.

Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.

title: Customer Success Associate (Rockville Centre Office)
description:
At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. Founded in 2012, we’re revolutionizing the real estate industry with our end-to-end platform that empowers residential real estate agents to deliver exceptional service to seller and buyer clients.


As a Customer Success Associate, AKA Agent Experience Coordinator, you are the first person our customers see when they walk into one of our Compass offices. You will oversee the management of the office to ensure everything is running smoothly and that our Compass office standards are being maintained. You will support a small roster of our customers with everything including understanding Compass, training on our tools and programs, assisting with marketing requests and more. As an AEC you are passionate about your customers, delivering a world class experience, and partnering with the rest of the agent experience team when support is needed.


**Please note: this role is 100% in-office in our Rockville Centre Office (with 25% travel to other local offices)**


**At Compass You Will:**


* Serve as the face of the office by welcoming guests, managing mail distribution, facilitating in-office event setup, and providing first-line support for office-related needs; responsible for the overall appearance and organization of the office, maintaining supply inventory, and escalating facilities issues
* Manage a small portfolio of customers directly by fielding questions and resolving issues via phone calls, emails, and in-person meetings
* Support the adoption of Compass technology and adjacent services by providing customers with 1:1 support
* Partner with the National Onboarding team on facilitation of onboarding processes for new customers
* Provide basic marketing support by answering questions, creating collateral from templates, and being the liaison to marketing specialists for more complex support requests
* Work collaboratively with other team members and departments to champion questions and feedback on behalf of agents
* Answer basic questions and troubleshoot issues related to technology/devices, conference room hardware, enterprise systems, etc.
* Provide ad-hoc administrative assistance as needed, such as sales meeting preparation, data entry, and office-wide communications
* Be a culture carrier who inspires and empowers those around you with a positive and constructive approach to creating and implementing change

**What We're Looking For:**


* 1-2 years previous experience in customer service, office management, hospitality, or operations
* Previous experience in real estate a plus
* Previous experience working with enterprise technology (Zendesk, Salesforce, Confluence) a plus
* Great listening skills, connects well with others, and is empathetic of the customer’s pain points
* A passion for creating community within a space; you encourage in-office interaction, bonding and engagement
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, allowing you to adapt and formulate solutions quickly
* Strong verbal communication and presentation skills
* Meticulous attention to detail, highly organized
* Ability to work in the office during standard operating hours
* Ability to lift up to 25 lbs

**Compensation:**



The base pay range for this position is $18.00 - $24.00 hourly; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Bonuses and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of benefits. Base pay is based on market location. Minimum wage for the position will always be met.


**Perks that You Need to Know About:**



Participation in our incentive programs (which may include where eligible cash, equity, or commissions). Plus paid vacation, holidays, sick time, parental leave, marriage leave, and recharge leave; medical, tele-health, dental and vision benefits; 401(k) plan; flexible spending accounts (FSAs); commuter program; life and disability insurance; Maven (a support system for new parents); Carrot (fertility benefits); UrbanSitter (caregiver referral network); Employee Assistance Program; and pet insurance.

  


**Do your best work, be your authentic self.**
At Compass, we believe that everyone deserves to find their place in the world — a place where they feel like they belong, where they can be their authentic selves, where they can thrive. Our collaborative, energetic culture is grounded in our Compass Entrepreneurship Principles and our commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, growth and mobility. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer competitive compensation packages, robust benefits and professional growth opportunities aimed at helping to improve our employees' lives and careers.

title: Warehouse Supervisor
description:
*(https://ryder.com/job-applicant-privacy-policy)*


**We are immediately hiring a Warehouse Supervisor in Port Reading, NJ for our Supply Chain Solutions division. Apply here today to speak with a Recruiter about the position and perks of joining our Ryder Ever Better Team.**


* Paid Twice Per Month
* Annual Salary Pay: $65,000 per year based on experience.
* Schedule: Monday-Friday 7:00 a.m. – 3:30 p.m.

When Fortune 500 businesses and new startups need supply chain solutions, they look to our industry-leading logistics experts. At Ryder, there is more to being a supply chain professional than working on some of the nation’s biggest brands. We make sure you are also getting the diverse experience, advancement opportunities, all from an industry-leading Fortune 500 company.


Here are a few of the many benefits when working with us:


* Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits start at 30 Days
* 401 (K) Savings Plan with a company match
* Discounted employee stock purchase options
* Quality employee discounts that actually save you money on tools, cars, appliances, travel and more
* All major holidays paid and Paid time off within your first year
* Up to 12 weeks paid maternity leave

**Summary**


Under the responsibility of the Manager, the Supervisor Logistics is responsible to supervise, coordinate and oversee the logistics operations and provide coaching, development and training to the staff members. The successful candidate must be able to provide recommendations for improvements to the facility, equipment, machinery, and processes. They will be accountable that the staff is performing to standard and has to ensure that progress is made to achieve the business objectives.


**Essential Functions**


* Supervise, coordinate and oversee day to day logistics operations;
* Plan and review, in collaboration with the Logistics Manager, all logistics processes, ensuring that they meet the company standards and customer service specifications
* Establish work schedules and procedures and coordinate activities of the workers to ensure optimal shift/team logistics
* Accountable for site Key Performance Indication (KPI)
* Working in collaboration with customer in all aspect of operations
* Meet regularly with team members collectively, as well as on an individual basis to monitor progress towards meeting objectives, track performance, coach and counsel as well as recognizing team and individual successes
* Cultivate team spirit with a Diversity and Inclusion initiative and promote cooperation by seeking opportunities to improve internal processes
* Carry out performance evaluations of the team members and recommend performance awards and/or merit increases when appropriate
* Address performance problems through corrective action and disciplinary process
* Understand labor agreement and maintain positive labor relations with all employees
* Responsible for implementation of health & safety and security initiatives, practices and behaviors and adherence to company rules and policies
* Provide appropriate orientation for employees and Lead Hands and give them the information, technology and any material necessary to perform their jobs

**Additional Responsibilities**


* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Skills and Abilities**


* Instills commitment to organizational goals
* Strong planning skills
* Results oriented
* Effective leadership skills
* Motivating skills
* Effective interpersonal skills
* Diverse team environment
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Possesses a high degree of initiative
* Ability to create and maintain professional relationships within all levels of the organization (peers, work groups, customers, supervisors)
* Ability to work independently and as a member of a team
* Flexibility to operate and self-driven to excel in a fast-paced environment
* Capable of multi-tasking, highly organized, with excellent time management skills
* Detail oriented with excellent follow-up practices

**Qualifications**


* College degree/Technical Certification required in Business, Logistics, Transportation or a related field. Combination of other education and experiences will be considered
* Three (3) years or more supervisory position experience in a warehouse environment or in Transportation required
* Three (3) years or more experience in monitoring, evaluating and rewarding employee performance required
* Three (3) years or more experience in performance management taking into account progressive discipline required
* Three (3) years or more experience preparing and conducting meetings (H&S and Employee committee) required
* Three (3) years or more experience investigating and reporting workplace accidents and incidents required

**DOT Regulated:** No


**Apply Here With Ryder Today**


We want YOU to join our family made up of Proud Women and Men in Logistics who work alongside Military Reserve and Veterans we hire every day!


Click here to see all Opportunities at Ryder: https://ryder.com/careers

title: Associate Biological Technician H-24
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.  

  

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

**The following positions will require the employees to work with chemical, radiological, or biological agents that may be hazardous to health if mishandled (including Agents which may potentially affect reproduction or the fetus). Employees will be required to follow all safety procedures and use personal protective clothing/Equipment where specified. Inquiries for further information should be directed to the hiring manager.**  

  

**R1583744 Associate Biological Technician (H24) or Biological Technician (H29)**  

  

**Shift:** 7am - 3:30pm (Monday-Friday)
  

  

**Location:** NBR Bldg 125
  

  

**Manager:** Mary McManus
  

  

**Rate:** $39.23
  

  

**Classification Description** **:**  

  

**ASSOCIATE BIOLOGICAL TECHNICIAN**  

  

Should have experience working with laboratory animals as deemed appropriate by management and in accordance with the Culture of Care and Animal Welfare Standards and Regulations.  

  

Work independently with numerous time-oriented tasks and need to manage time and workflow as necessary under the guidance and checks and follow standard practices in performance of routine work. Work cooperatively with other employees in efforts to achieve departmental goals.  

  

Will perform responsibilities in compliance with all applicable SOPs, study protocols, GLP guidelines, and other Federal, State, and corporate policies and guidelines.  

  

**EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS** **:**  

  

The **Associate Biological Technician** with a Bachelor's Degree will be required to achieve their ALAT certification within 12 months, become certified at the LAT level within 18 months of completing their ALAT, and encouraged to complete certification at the LATG.
  

  

Those who do not meet the ALAT certification requirements within 12 months will be considered as not meeting the requirements for the position and be required to bid on a position  

  

* H24 - Associate Biological Technician = BS degree or AS degree and LATg certification

  

* H29 - Biological Technician = BS degree and LATg certification

  

**WORKING CONDITIONS** **:*** Moderate physical effort required. May involve intermittent heavy lifting, pushing or pulling.
* Be able to lift objects of 50 pounds and push/pull large objects with a force of 50 pounds.
* Medical screening prior to initial placement in Veterinary Sciences is required to evaluate for history of allergy, asthma or physical problems which could endanger an employee in this work environment and to evaluate for the presence of zoonotic diseases e.g. Tuberculosis, MMR vaccine.
* The employee will have frequent exposure to biohazards and disagreeable conditions, including odors, heat, noise, animal excrement, and dander and will have potential exposure to toxic test compounds or radio-labeled test materials.
* Be able to wear appropriate PPE including fit tested respirators, safety shoes and lab apparel.
* In order for the development process to be successful, there must be excellent collaboration, during the course of an experiment as necessary based on sound scientific judgment.
* Involvement of the union staff in the various experimental studies and other processes is determined by management based on the dynamic nature of the research process.

**JOB FUNCTION - NONCLINICAL SAFETY AND VETERINARY SCIENCE**  

  

Routine Animal Care Operations  

  

Perform routine animal care activities and operations to include but not limited to:* Follow all BMS policies, procedures and SOPs.
* Detailed observations of the animals to recognize abnormal symptoms and behavior and report problems through established systems.
* Prepare food and feed the animals correct portions according to specifications.
* Clean animal rooms and maintain general cleanliness of the animal areas and ancillary spaces.
* Handle and restrain animals using appropriate techniques and assist others in restraint and handling as required.
* Receive or prepare animals for shipment.
* Provide exercise and or environmental enrichment.
* Acclimatization and training of animals to routine procedures.
* Maintain breeding colonies (e.g. make and record animal observations, offer special feedings, weaning, identification, sample collection/shipping), and associated sample and data collection (e.g. census, breeding and weaning records)
* Assemble, clean, use, monitor and maintain animal caging and associated equipment.
* Assist in related quality sampling and testing (e.g. sanitization effectiveness)
* Clean and sterilize animal cages, feeders, bottles, and other equipment using autoclaves and other sanitization equipment (e.g., ozone, VHP, fogging) and assist in planning workflow, staging and storage of materials.
* Receive and store feed, bedding and other supplies.
* Ensure storage and animal areas supplies are appropriately stocked.
* Assist in or demonstrate proper work procedures to trainees and other personnel as requested.

Program of Veterinary Care Support
  

  

Assist in technical aspects of the veterinary care program but not limited to:* Assist with administration of veterinary treatments and procedures (e.g., injections, application, dosing, biologic sample collection).
* Assist with routine colony health activities and associated testing (e.g., animal grooming, trimming nails, euthanasia of animals, teeth maintenance, TB testing).
* Assist with animal medical data recording and reporting
* Prepare animals and samples for testing, observe tests, and detect and report responses;
* Perform support duties that involve animal health maintenance, i.e., sentinel program, water and feed sampling and evaluation, sanitation sampling and testing, and other related tests, as required;
* May be required to correlate and calculate related data, summarize and record test results and assays;


Study and Scientific Support
* Responsible for reading all study protocols
* Assist in the preparation and execution of research activities including but not limited to:
* Identification and observation of animals
* Animal restraint
* Compound or drug preparation, handling, sampling and administration
* Data collection (e.g. body weight, food consumption, clinical observations)
* Biologic sample collection and processing
* Euthanasia and tissue collection
* Associated record keeping and data entry
* Dissection and removal of internal organs and/or tissues, limited necropsies under supervision, tissue embedding and microtoming, preparation of specimens for archiving, and quality control checks for tissue blocks and slides;
* Assist scientific staff with other study activities and preparation as directed
* Participate in employee training and ongoing training and education programs as required.
* May be required to correlate and calculate related data, summarize and record test results and assays;
* Processing tissue and excreta samples from laboratory animals; handling of radio-labeled test materials.
* Work with others in scheduling and carrying out established standard biological assays and present the results as written notes and verbal reports
* Perform such tests and assays using appropriate equipment and techniques in areas of biology, pharmacokinetics, simple chemistry, microbiology, and immunology, under supervision, may assist with the writing of new or revised procedures


If you come across a role that intrigues you but doesn't perfectly line up with your resume, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be one step away from work that will transform your life and career.
  

  

**Uniquely Interesting Work, Life-changing Careers**  

With a single vision as inspiring as Transforming patients' lives through science™ , every BMS employee plays an integral role in work that goes far beyond ordinary. Each of us is empowered to apply our individual talents and unique perspectives in an inclusive culture, promoting diversity in clinical trials, while our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  

  

**On-site Protocol**  

  

BMS has a diverse occupancy structure that determines where an employee is required to conduct their work. This structure includes site-essential, site-by-design, field-based and remote-by-design jobs. The occupancy type that you are assigned is determined by the nature and responsibilities of your role:
  

  

Site-essential roles require 100% of shifts onsite at your assigned facility. Site-by-design roles may be eligible for a hybrid work model with at least 50% onsite at your assigned facility. For these roles, onsite presence is considered an essential job function and is critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, and a positive Company culture. For field-based and remote-by-design roles the ability to physically travel to visit customers, patients or business partners and to attend meetings on behalf of BMS as directed is an essential job function.
  

  

BMS is dedicated to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace accommodations/adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request a reasonable workplace accommodation/adjustment prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodations/adjustments in completing this application, or in any part of the recruitment process, direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com . Visit careers.bms.com/ eeo -accessibility to access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement.
  

  

BMS cares about your well-being and the well-being of our staff, customers, patients, and communities. As a result, the Company strongly recommends that all employees be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 and keep up to date with Covid-19 boosters.
  

  

BMS will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable laws in your area.  

  

Any data processed in connection with role applications will be treated in accordance with applicable data privacy policies and regulations.

title: Manager, Business Operations
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

**Biologics Manufacturing**  

  

Biologics is changing the landscape of disease treatment, and BMS is expanding our biologics manufacturing capacity and development. This investment is our commitment to patients and the future of therapeutic advancements. Our state-of-the-art biologics facility spans across biologics process development, clinical trials, and commercial manufacturing with the approach to expedite the progression of potential therapies and reaching our patients. Our BMS scientists, engineers, bioprocess operators, quality specialists, and an array of other professionals work together in their shared commitment delivering more medicines to more patients faster.  

  

**Position:** Manager, Business Operations  

  

**Location**: Devens, MA; New Brunswick, NJ; Summit, NJ  

  

**Position Summary**  

  

The Biologics Development Business Operations department supports both strategic and operational objectives for Biologics Development including finance, project management, resource management, outsourcing, and operational excellence. Reporting to the Director of Business Operations, this individual will be responsible for the planning and execution of a broad range of activities to support Biologics Development organization including budget maintenance, contract management and operational excellence.  

  

**Key Responsibilities*** Responsible for the identification and implementation of Biologics Development (BD) Operational Excellence projects, with the goal of delivering productivity improvements across BD
* Leads in the development, implementation, and refinement of project management tools and metrics
* Support Biologics Development Book of Work through management of outsourced portfolio and associated OpEx & R&D Study Supplies Budget (forecasting, actuals and projections)
* Maintain and improve collaboration tools for tracking Book of Work, Budget Management and associated data analysis
* Provide input to strategic sourcing strategy and vendor relationships
* Serve as project manager and /or participate, as needed, in any initiatives that are identified in BD annual objectives and/or strategic initiatives
* Provide departmental business operations support (track objectives, facilitate staff meetings, create/maintain SharePoint sites amongst other activities)

**Qualifications & Experience*** Bachelor's degree in business or relevant scientific discipline with >3 years of relevant experience in pharmaceutical or related industry. Advanced degree or MBA preferred
* Project management experience with the ability to develop clear action plans and drive execution to meet timelines and deliver on commitments
* Demonstrated ability to build relationships, influence, negotiate, and drive organizational engagement
* Capable of bringing structure to vaguely defined problems while using creative yet pragmatic problem-solving approaches and execution management
* Highly effective written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
* Strong presentation, facilitation, and messaging skills
* Strong ability to ensure connectivity across multiple functions across sites and with the enterprise

title: Executive Associate
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.  

  

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

**Position Summary:**  

  

Executive Associate to Vice President, US Sotyktu Sales and Marketing
  

  

This Executive Associate position reports to the Vice President, US Sotyktu Sales and Marketing and performs highly diverse administrative and project focused duties, which by nature of the position may involve high level contacts and exposure to confidential material necessitating the use of tact, diplomacy, discretion, and judgment. We are looking for a dynamic, performance driven, well organized and flexible individual with proven skills in prioritizing and multi-tasking, as well as the ability to remain poised and focused in a fast-paced environment.
  

  

**Key Responsibilities:*** Calendar management as well as timely scheduling ensuring meetings are prioritized and occur within appropriate timelines.
* Assist with group operations through scheduling team meetings, performance check-in meetings, etc.
* Prioritizes activities and takes prompt action based on an understanding of departmental objectives and business needs.
* Adhere to T&E policies, including booking international and domestic travel and monthly reconciliation of business expenses for executive(s).
* Ensure manager's preparedness for all meetings (e.g., assemble meeting materials, technology testing, communication to attendees & pre-reads).
* Prioritize and complete support requests in a timely manner (i.e. issues with IT, systems, facilities, etc.)
* Independently researches more complex inquiries and responds or escalates inquiry, recommending solutions as appropriate.
* Meeting planning and logistics support.
* Maintain up to date organizational information for department (organizational charts, etc.)
* Assist with employee onboarding and exits.
* Maintains professional and technical knowledge by remaining current with BMS continuous learning modules.

title: Assistant Barn Manager
description:
To assist and oversee and manage daily operations throughout the seasons and seasonal changes. Job entails a hands-on management of the facilities and staff. To assist keeping all barn horses in good working condition and care for the needs of the boarder horses as obligated in boarder agreement. To maintain a level of professionalism with staff and clients at all times. To maintain business integrity and enforce all rules and regulations.

* Daily opening and closing of the facility.
* Operate a western trail program.
* Horse care as needed.
* Hay and shavings management.
* Farrier shoeing schedule for barn horses.
* Lesson program instructor.
* Staffing and scheduling oversight.
* Program assistance.
* Event management – oversight and staffing.
* Customer outreach and satisfaction.
* Safety protocols and compliance – staff horses and clients.

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

title: Administrative Coordinator
description:
Administrative coordinator

Residential Services

PRFI's Administrative Coordinator for Residential Services role will be crucial in overseeing and ensuring efficient operations of the Residential Services and supporting its growth. The Administrative Coordinator will serve as the backbone of coordinating day to day operations, facilitating smooth communication, coordinating schedules, taking minutes of all different committees and managing administrative tasks.

A successful candidate will be a natural leader, proactive self-starter, and possess an approachable demeanor that exudes positivity and professionalism.

· Must have high level of interpersonal skills and able to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of organizations, both internally and externally. The ideal candidate is positive, reliable, strong attention to detail, and able to learn new technology and industry-specific programs quickly.

· Ability to adapt, problem solve, identify problems and work towards resolution in a timely manner. The candidate will be asked to research and obtain information to complete various forms, tasks, and processes. Prepare updates on the status of development projects.

· Manage calendars as requested, including scheduling appointments and tracking deadlines.

· Write and manage correspondence.

· Handle calls (take and deliver messages) emailing, and faxing.

· Catalog and organize company contacts, leases, and files.

PRFI is seeking someone who is organized and able to assist in managing the workflow of the program.

· Strong communication skills with clients, and other PRFI’s personnel.

· Knowledge of complex editing, printing and formatting of documents, letters, minutes collections, vouchers payments, credit cards receipts, spreadsheets and presentations.

title: Associate Specialist, Value Stream Cryo Operations (Wed-Sat 5a-530p)
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.  

  

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

At **Bristol Myers Squibb** we are reimagining the future of cell therapy. With our bold ambition, backed by a best-in-the-industry team and long-term commitment, we are leading the way to unlock the full promise of cell therapy as we strive to put more patients on the path to a cure. If you are ready to challenge yourself, accelerate your career, and give new hope to patients, there's no better place than here at BMS with our Cell Therapy team.  

  

**Associate Specialist, Value Stream Cryo Operations** is responsible for the Cryopreservation, movement, storage, control of manufacturing patient materials, and support of Liquid Nitrogen storage tanks and equipment at the CAR T manufacturing facility in Summit, NJ. This includes but is not limited to, cryopreservation, storage, inventory control, chain of custody, and material tracking.  

  

**Shifts Available:*** Every Other Wednesday - Saturday 5 a.m. - 5:30 p.m., Onsite

**Responsibilities:*** Responsible for cryopreservation and management of including:
* Handling patient material throughout the material Cryopreservation, storage, distribution, transfer, and disposal.
* Maintaining sample tracking and chain of custody records in accordance with GMP requirements and written procedures.
* Ensuring that obsolete or expired samples and materials are destroyed and disposed of according to written procedures.
* Performing sample queries and periodic storage reports, as required.
* Assisting management with investigations and deviations related to sample management.
* Collaborating with other departments to identity and implement process efficiencies.
* Maintaining metrics for the Value Stream Cryo Operations group.
* Facilitating cold chain transfers of material, as required.
* Performs tasks for Cell Therapy products to support product Value Stream outputs according to Current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP's) following the current, approved Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and Work Instructions (WIs).
* Maintains timing according to the production schedule to ensure on-time
* Cryopreservation support.
* Cryopreserve Patient material daily, store and manage Inventory of material in LN2 storage locations.
* Supports manual and electronic batch record executions, deviation investigations, and closure of CAPAs.
* Maintains timing according to the production schedule to ensure on-time logistics.
* Ensures all documentation is correct and addresses procedural/documentation errors expeditiously and effectively.
* Work with management to ensure adequately trained personnel are available to perform all Value Stream Cryo Operations activities.
* Records patient material handling data and information in a clear, concise, format according to proper GDPs.
* Able to problem solve with minimal supervision.
* Works in a team based, cross-functional environment to complete tasks required by shift schedule.
* Other duties may be assigned, as necessary.
* Available to work OT when business requires.
* Willing to work staggered day shift hours.

**Basic Requirements:*** Bachelor's degree
* OR Associate/ Medical Technical degree and 0-2 years of Manufacturing or Operations experience.
* OR High School diploma/GED and 2-4 years of Manufacturing or Operations experience.
* Experience with cold chain sample storage and transfer. • Knowledge of cGMP/FDA regulated industry. • Basic mathematical skills • General understanding of cGMPs • Technical writing capability • Proficient in MS Office applications • Inventory control and/or management • Background to include an understanding of biology, chemistry, medical or clinical practices is a plus.

title: Associate Scientist, Biologics Process Analytics
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.  

  

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

**Biologics Manufacturing**  

  

Biologics is changing the landscape of disease treatment, and BMS is expanding our biologics manufacturing capacity and development. This investment is our commitment to patients and the future of therapeutic advancements. Our state-of-the-art biologics facility spans across biologics process development, clinical trials, and commercial manufacturing with the approach to expedite the progression of potential therapies and reaching our patients. Our BMS scientists, engineers, bioprocess operators, quality specialists, and an array of other professionals work together in their shared commitment delivering more medicines to more patients faster.  

  

Our Biologics Development team is responsible for development and transfer of safe, efficient, and approvable biologics drug substance manufacturing processes and analytical methods for all of BMS' biologics portfolio. We work closely with other BMS units to support our clinical pipeline through to late stages of clinical development. Innovation is at the core of what we do, with an intense focus on efficiency, speed, robustness, and approvability of our processes and methods. Here, you'll get the chance to through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, pursue innovative ideas, and advance professionally alongside some of the brightest minds in Biopharma.  

  

The Biologics Process Analytics team seeks to leverage the best in analytical chemistry, state-of-the-art instrumentation, and automation to enable timely production of high quality biotherapeutics for clinical trials and commercial manufacturing. The biotherapeutic modalities we support include monoclonal antibodies, bispecific and trispecific antibodies, fusion proteins, antibody-drug conjugates, viral vectors, and more.  

  

**Position Summary**  

  

This position will leverage analytical chemistry and lab automation to provide high-throughput testing support for Biologics Process and Cell Line Development at our Summit West site.  

  

**Key Responsibilities*** Support in-process analytical testing for monoclonal antibodies and fusion proteins, including HPLC/UPLC, isoelectric focusing, capillary electrophoresis, ELISA, qPCR, etc.
* Implement state-of-the-art lab automation to simplify and streamline lab work
* Provide high-throughput purification support for analytical testing.
* Evaluate new analytical methods for improving analytical capability and assay performance.
* Support method standardization activities in collaboration with partner groups at New Brunswick, Devens, and other BMS sites.
* Maintain collaborative interactions with Research and Development, Method Development, Characterization, Process Development and GMP Manufacturing teams.
* Maintain accurate and up to date laboratory e-notebook documentation.
* Learn analytical skills needed to support future assays for the next generation of biologics programs
* Sustain a safe and high-performance laboratory environment.
* On-site presence is required to complete the primary responsibilities of this position.

**Qualifications & Experience*** Bachelors degree in Analytical Biochemistry, Analytical Chemistry, Biotechnology, Engineering or related field with a minimum of 1-3 years of relevant experience.
* Proficiency desirable in programming and method automation development for robotic liquid handlers, such as Tecan or similar platforms.
* Experience with sample preparation techniques a plus including high-throughput affinity purification, and other SPE approaches. Preparatory chromatography (AKTA) experience is beneficial.
* Experience in a variety of protein bioanalytical techniques, including titer by LC, N-glycan characterization, iCIEF, size exclusion HPLC and UPLC, capillary electrophoresis, and ELISA.
* Some knowledge or experience of nucleotide bioanalytical techniques is beneficial, including southern blot, northern blot, reverse transcription, and qPCR.
* A basic understanding of cell line, upstream and downstream process development.
* Proficient in use of Empower, LIMS software, SYMYX ELN, Microsoft office applications.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills.
* Working knowledge of statistical experimental design and data analysis.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

title: Director, Foundational Content Capabilities
description:

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

**Position Summary:**  

  

The Content Capabilities Lead is responsible for spearheading the evolution of Bristol Myers Squibb's (BMS) content capabilities. This role encompasses the management of platforms used for content concept review, content assembly, MLR (Medical, Legal, Regulatory) review, and the distribution of content across various channels and customers. The ideal candidate will work closely with key stakeholders across the organization to establish and create key performance indicators (KPIs) that measure the success and learnings of all content capability initiatives. This role requires deep subject matter expertise in content platform functionality, content processes, integration processes, and content KPI tracking.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:*** Responsible for leading the evolving BMS content capabilities which enable concept review, assembly, MLR review, and distribution of content across channels and customers as needed. Work with key stakeholders across the organization to establish and create key performance indicators measuring the success/learnings on all content capability initiatives.
* Acquire and retain the subject matter expertise of all content platform functionality, content processes, integration processes, and content KPI tracking.
* Successfully oversee the business ownership tasks required to support all foundational content capabilities for modular content libraries, review and approval systems, content authoring systems, channel distribution systems and integrations, etc.
* Primary connection point to commercial and view across the enterprise content capability needs.
* Lead on new and evolving content capabilities and key enhancements within the content capability ecosystem, navigates key connection points across a matrix partners (WCE, IT, procurement, business, legal, medical, regulatory (MLR), compliance and others) to facilitate the execution of initiatives.
* Lead content capability and platform functionality training material creation and maintenance, curriculum by role, and delivery planning as needed.
* Interface with senior levels of leadership on key initiative to educate and drive alignment on path forward for their business.
* Drives innovation culture in the content capability landscape and coordinates with business and omni-channel capability leads to evolve content capabilities with metrics/analytics driven approach
* Leads the initial creation, socialization and onboarding of operating models, capability roadmaps with Medical, Legal, Regulatory Standards processes for content capabilities
* Manages stakeholders and expectations regarding content management capabilities and MLR (Medical/Legal/Regulatory) processes
* Identify opportunities for synergies and collaboration within and across markets within the content capabilities ecosystem
* Business owner of validated content management systems. Responsible for system implementation including: build requirements, testing, end user training and all validation tasks
* Establish new content capabilities and operations based on enterprise adoption and evolution.
* Contributes to continuous improvement of content capabilities and provides input into Omni-Channel capabilities.
* Provides expertise into the ongoing evolution of content capabilities and operations by working with business leads, WCE on critical business priorities.
* Maintains view of the competitive landscape and has a broad perspective across BMS and pharma industry to identify and drive best practice around content expertise.
* Oversee all platform access strategy planning and design.
* Identify, execute and manage budget for assigned capabilities.
* Monitor project status and budget and provide regular reporting on progress, challenges, and solutions

**Qualifications and Experience:*** Bachelors degree required; Preferred MBA or MS; or equivalent experience value
* Minimum of 15+ years of business experience or similar experience
* Significant experience in leading content management ecosystems, content - automation and content distribution analytics strategy.
* Experience working in Veeva Vault PromoMats
* Experience working in eWizard
* Proven coaching and competency development skills
* Significant experience interfacing with senior levels of organizations
* Experience in managing validated computer systems
* Proven ability in managing agencies, capability vendors, and cross-functional support teams
* Demonstrated excellence in operational effectiveness
* Proven track record of coordinating and collaboration across multiple teams to prioritize varying business objectives and drive action to meet business requirements; recognized as an influential leader with credibility in conflict management and expectation management
* Proven track record of planning, prioritizing, and driving new capabilities within a complex organization.
* development/execution through effective project management and internal negotiation skills to build consensus, resolve conflicts and manage expectations
* Significant experience and knowledge of navigating the Legal/Medical/Regulatory review process in new omni-channel capabilities
* Strong oral, written and interpersonal communication skills
* Experience working in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry preferred
* Experience working with commercial and Medical/Legal/Regulatory business partners preferred
* Both US and ex-US business experience

title: Director Integrated Digital Channel Deployment
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

**Position Summary**  

  

The Director- Integrated Digital Channel Deployment, is a key position on the WW Integrated Content Delivery team. The Director- Digital channels will develop and oversee an integrated digital experience for Commercial websites (primary), emails, messaging programs, podcasts for BMS worldwide. This role is responsible for the strategy, development, and direction of our web channels and other digital channels, which will include the roadmaps, standards, op models and training to deliver a digital presence that our brands/ markets can leverage and create a competitive differentiation.
  

  

**Key Responsibilities**  

WW Integrated Digital Channel Deployment defines, builds, and supports the WW Website Engagement strategy to help drive customer engagement with BMS via the web, providing a seamless, consistent, and optimized experience across multiple digital platforms (desktop, mobile etc.). This role also has a process oversight into additional channels like home office emails, one way messaging, podcasts, chat and other digital related channels.* Business ownership of relevant platforms and channels used for content deployment and customers engagement.
	+ Ensuring content to customers across multiple digital devices for products, campaigns, services etc.
	+ Responsible for the roadmap, standards, processes, training, change management of the web capabilities and support the other digital channels as the business POC
* Ensuring the web content is up to standard and consistent with organization approach.
* Partnership with other channel deployment leads to drive adoption and performance of the home office emails and messaging, podcast channels, and personalization technologies across the channels.
* Facilitate the content creation and approval process with established standards, templates, and best practices.
* Drive customer engagement with the brand through user friendly web platforms and through seamless integration with other capabilities like WW Reg, Live chat, social share, podcast, one way messaging, emails etc.
* Business product owner of the Build Easy platform including strategy, development & direction of our worldwide website capabilities team through creation of standards, roadmap, op models and platforms.
* Creates and partners in execution of innovative and effective digital delivery capabilities and strategies that can be leveraged companywide.
* Identifies key connection points across matrix partners (Brands, Markets, Engagement Planners, Medical, BI&A, Commercial, Clinical Trials, IT, procurement, business, legal, medical, regulatory (MLR), compliance and others) to help facilitate the well thought out execution of initiatives.
* Partner closely and lead with other internal and external teams to ensure organizational alignment and to drive efficiency companywide- aligning with enterprise-wide initiatives.
* Extensive experience and subject matter expertise - Interface with various levels of leadership educate/ evangelize them on available capabilities and drive alignment on path forward for their business.
* Local Market digital channel customizations
	+ Build market specific capabilities for key international markets.
	+ Drive thought leadership on impact of omni-channel capabilities (web and other channels) to international markets and enable future enhancements and evolution.
	+ Enable blend on standardized vs. customized web templates to international markets.

**Qualifications & Experience*** Experience in leading omni-channel touchpoints, understanding of digital channels - web, home office emails, SMS, one way messaging, personalization technologies.
* Deep experience in web related technologies
* Bachelor's degree required or graduate degree preferred
* Significant experience interfacing with different levels of organization
* Experience in omni-channel capabilities
* Proven ability in managing digital agencies, capability vendors, and cross-functional support teams.
* Demonstrated excellence in operational effectiveness.
* Proven track record of coordinating and collaboration across multiple teams to prioritize varying business objectives and drive action to meet business requirements; recognized as an influential leader with credibility in conflict management and expectation management.
* Proven track record of planning, prioritizing, and driving new omni-channel capabilities within a complex organization.
* Development/execution through effective project management and internal negotiation skills to build consensus, resolve conflicts and manage expectations.
* 15+ years in project/program management
* Experience and knowledge of navigating the Legal/Medical/Regulatory review process in new omni-channel capabilities.
* Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Experience working in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry preferred.
* Experience working with commercial and medical/R&D business partners preferred.
* Both US and ex-US business experience


If you come across a role that intrigues you but doesn't perfectly line up with your resume, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be one step away from work that will transform your life and career.
  

  

**Uniquely Interesting Work, Life-changing Careers**  

With a single vision as inspiring as Transforming patients' lives through science™ , every BMS employee plays an integral role in work that goes far beyond ordinary. Each of us is empowered to apply our individual talents and unique perspectives in an inclusive culture, promoting diversity in clinical trials, while our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  

  

**On-site Protocol**  

  

BMS has a diverse occupancy structure that determines where an employee is required to conduct their work. This structure includes site-essential, site-by-design, field-based and remote-by-design jobs. The occupancy type that you are assigned is determined by the nature and responsibilities of your role:
  

  

Site-essential roles require 100% of shifts onsite at your assigned facility. Site-by-design roles may be eligible for a hybrid work model with at least 50% onsite at your assigned facility. For these roles, onsite presence is considered an essential job function and is critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, and a positive Company culture. For field-based and remote-by-design roles the ability to physically travel to visit customers, patients or business partners and to attend meetings on behalf of BMS as directed is an essential job function.
  

  

BMS is dedicated to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace accommodations/adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request a reasonable workplace accommodation/adjustment prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodations/adjustments in completing this application, or in any part of the recruitment process, direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com . Visit careers.bms.com/ eeo -accessibility to access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement.
  

  

BMS cares about your well-being and the well-being of our staff, customers, patients, and communities. As a result, the Company strongly recommends that all employees be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 and keep up to date with Covid-19 boosters.
  

  

BMS will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable laws in your area.  

  

Any data processed in connection with role applications will be treated in accordance with applicable data privacy policies and regulations.

title: Radiology Tech CWR - RT24-11723
description:
**Job Title:** Radiology Tech CWR
  

**Location:** Hackensack, NJ 07601  

**Duration:** 3 Months


**Shift Information:**


**Hours per Week:** 40  

**Hours per Day:** 8  

**Days per Week:** 5


**Shift Timing:** Monday - Friday, 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM


**Schedule Notes:** No weekends. Will be required to work holidays if it falls on their scheduled shift.


**Job Summary:**



The Radiologic Technologist I is responsible for obtaining diagnostic radiographic examinations at a technical level not requiring constant supervision. This role involves producing diagnostic images, performing portable x-ray exams, and assisting physicians in administering radiopaque contrast media.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Produce diagnostic radiographic examinations by positioning patients, providing immobilization devices, and selecting appropriate technical factors based on individual patient needs.
* Restrict the radiation beam through cone and collimating devices to prevent exposure to unaffected parts of the patient.
* Perform portable x-ray examinations in patient rooms, operating rooms, and emergency rooms.
* Follow operational procedures to identify patient films with the correct name and x-ray number, and mark the film accurately.
* Develop exposed x-ray films using available processing methods. Complete patient requisitions with technologist initials, date, number, and size of film.
* Maintain an orderly x-ray room as directed by the head of the department.
* Prepare radiopaque contrast media and assist physicians in administering radiopaque mixtures to patients.
* Perform administrative duties related to scheduling appointments, patient instructions, film filing, maintenance of records, reception of patients, and other administrative tasks as required.
* Provide assistance to patients in moving, turning, and getting on and off x-ray tables based on individual patient needs and abilities.
* Lift a minimum of 5 lbs., push and pull a minimum of 10 lbs., and stand for a minimum of 6 hours a day.
* Identify the needs of the patient population served and modify and deliver care specific to those needs, including age, culture, language, and impairments.
* Communicate with patients, parents, and/or primary caregivers at their level of understanding.
* Adhere to the standards identified in the Medical Center's Organizational Competencies.


**Skills and Qualifications:**


**Required:**


* Minimum of 2 years of experience in an acute care facility.
* Ability to work independently in emergency room and trauma settings.


**Education:**


* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Completion of an AMA-approved school of Radiologic Technology.
* Completion of clinical and A.R.R.T. requirements.


**Certi****fications & Licensure:**


* New Jersey State License.
* Meet the requirements for the National Registry and pass the examination.
* American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) certification.
* Basic Life Support (BLS) certification from the American Heart Association (AHA).


**Languages:** Proficiency in English (Speak, Read, Write)


**Minimum Degree Required:** Completed High School (Diploma or GED)

title: Educational Activity Specialist/Instructor
description:
Community Counseling and Mediation is seeking a Group Leader for one of After-School programs based in PS 238.

**Qualifications:** 

Candidates must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, as well as strong classroom management skills. The candidate must have experience developing and implementing curriculum for middle school youths. All activity specialists must be fingerprinted and proven to be free of any criminal convictions before being hired.

**Function:**

As a part of the after-school team, part-time activity specialists provide focused lessons in their area of expertise to students enrolled in the FYI after-school program. Specialists will work closely with particpants to encourage movement, creativity and develop skills in the specific activity.

**Duties and Responsibilities:** 

* Develop and implement project based lesson plans and activities in areas of expertise that enrich academic learning, foster the personal development and leadership skills of middle school youths.
* Develop appropriate lesson plans and submit them for review to the Program Director.
* Provide opportunities for students to showcase their work
* Partner with outside agencies and cultural institutions to expand programming and plan trips
* Maintain accurate participant attendance, activity and sign-out records Document student progress
* Establish a comfortable learning environment and implement clear, consistent age appropriate expectations and rules
* Uphold program policies and procedures and proper use of supplies and materials
* Maintain classroom cleanliness and organization
* Maintain ongoing open communication with parents and day school teachers
* Attend staff meetings, professional development workshops and program events
* Communicate with all staff, parents, children, and community members in a polite and respectable manner so as to represent the program professionally

* High School Diploma
* Previous work experience in a school age setting

**Experience**

* 3 to 5 years experience in a related field

title: Design Director, Brand (Hero Cosmetics)
description:
A collective energy and ambition. A place where you can make a real difference.  

We’re a company that genuinely cares about our people, our products, our consumers and the environment.  

Our unique, informal culture champions courage, determination and collaboration. Knowing we have an open and supportive team means each of us has the freedom to take responsibility and ownership. We have a shared passion to work hard, innovate and push boundaries.
United by the belief that when we strive for growth, anything is possible. While we might not be the largest company in our industry, we believe we can have the biggest impact because: Together We Have the Power to Win.
Who We Are
Hero Cosmetics is a functional skin solution brand focused on acne-prone skin and part of the Church & Dwight family of power brands. We develop products such as the Might Patch, Rescue Balm, and Lighting Wand to address the full lifecycle of acne. Acne-prone skin is human, and it can often feel entirely out of our control. We’re here to help put the power back in our consumers’ hands. Whether they’re looking to prevent, treat, or repair – we create gentle, effective solutions that help their skin fight back; so everyone can open up, not cover up. The true heros are not the products we make, but the people we serve.
Working conditions
This is a Hybrid role with flexibility to work remotely and in our NYC office at 407 Broome St, New York, NY. Will need to be commutable to NYC office for onsite requirements and business needs.
What you’ll do:  

  

Creative* Guide the overall design direction and execution of assets with a 360 approach across all communication channels—digital to print.
* Work closely with departments such as marketing and content to ensure cohesive brand storytelling and design execution.
* Lead design reviews to ensure team-wide participation and alignment internally before presenting creative work, reviewing to verify the accuracy of information, ensure alignment with our brand, maintain quality standards, and optimize design efforts.
* Educate stakeholders on design decisions and the impact of design on user experience and business outcomes.
* Work with Creative Ops to estimate hours and assign creative team members best suited for each project based on ability and workload and manage workloads to maximize productivity
* Keep abreast of the latest photography, video, and social media trends to create engaging and relevant content.
* Leverage strong skills in campaign strategy and a keen eye for art direction, design, type, and layout to inspire and guide the team to deliver exceptional creative work.
  

Collaboration* Engage with clients, vendors, or external partners to understand requirements and ensure design solutions meet their needs.
* Foster a strong link between art direction and copywriting, setting high storytelling standards visually and verbally.
* Encourage collaboration among designers, illustrators, UX/UI designers, and other creatives to share ideas, and collectively solve design challenges.
* Present work and develop collaborative cross-functional relationships of value and respect.
* Create a feedback culture of offering constructive feedback to designers, helping them refine their work and align it with project goals. Stay open to feedback from team members and stakeholders to continuously improve designs and processes.
  

  

Team* Manage and mentor designers and art directors. Foster an environment that encourages growth, learning, and curiosity.
* Provide written and face-to-face feedback for performance reviews and ongoing feedback throughout the year.
* Set the tone for the team by being supportive and approachable. Acknowledge and celebrate both individual and team successes.
  

Who you are:* Multifaceted background with 10+ years of agency and/or in-house experience
* BFA or BA in graphic design, advertising, fine arts, or a relevant field preferred
* Substantial knowledge of pre and post-production—including retouching, pre-press, proofing
* Proficiency in Figma, Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator, and an understanding of e-commerce best practices.
* A leadership style characterized by compassion and empathy, prioritizing a team-centric approach, and maintaining a humble, ego-free demeanor.
* Demonstrate the ability to create and execute 360-degree campaigns, including various assets like print materials, in-store visuals, digital content, and social media initiatives. Proactively make recommendations on process improvement and new ways of working.
* Experience working cross-functionally, balancing the needs of stakeholders, and breaking down complex narratives or marketing strategies into simple but compelling ideas and executions
* Tackles ambiguous problems and shaping them into clear goals
* Strong leadership skills and can organize, motivate, and improve the creative output of those around you
* Strong relationship-building skills; ability to work with a variety of people in various disciplines; cross-functional collaborator
* Strong portfolio to demonstrate originality and innovation
* Ability to sell creative ideas to senior leaders and management
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
* Excellent attention to detail and very organized, a time management expert
* Discerning eye for design with a deep knowledge of beauty space and branding
* Takes work seriously but maintains a sense of fun and creativity.
  

Compensation
The US base salary range for this full-time position is $121,600 - $190,000. This position is also eligible for a bonus.
As a Church & Dwight US employee, you (and your family) will have access to medical, dental, vision, basic life insurance, paid vacation and sick time, and Paid Parental Leave. U.S. employees are entitled to paid holidays, floating holidays, and vacation days starting in their first year of employment depending on hire date. You are also able to participate in our 401k retirement plan (with company match).

**THE BEST CAREERS.** RIGHT HERE

@ BROOKLYN’S LEADING HEALTHCARE SYSTEM**.**

We’re Maimonides Health, Brooklyn’s largest healthcare system, serving over 250,000 patients each year through the system’s 3 hospitals, 1800 physicians, more than 80 community-based practices and outpatient centers*. title: Director of Activities
description:
**Position Summary****:** Responsible for planning and implementing life enriching programs and events which provide socialization opportunities, fitness and wellness activities, educational and recreational programs, as well as spiritual life support based on the needs and preferences of the residents in the community. This position reports to the Administrator and supervises the activities departmental staff.

  


**Essential Functions****:**

  


* Attends work as scheduled and follows community’s call-off procedures.
* Plan, schedule and implement a program of individual and group activities based on residents’ schedule.
* Assess and complete the sections of the Minimum Data Set (MDS) assigned completely, timely and accurately.
* Use the resident assessment protocols (RAPs) to determine whether to proceed to care planning for concerns related to a resident’s activity program needs.
* Gather data and document required ancillary assessments including but not limited to resident assessment protocol summary documentation.
* Identify and document in the resident’s care plan, the activity interests, needs, and concerns of the resident. Care plans are reviewed and updated as necessary but at least quarterly.
* Document all interaction with resident and/or family in the assessment, care plan and progress notes as required by federal and state requirements.
* Participate as an active member of the interdisciplinary team and attend all resident care conferences.
* Plan and implement Reality Orientation programs when appropriate.
* Participate in nursing restorative and rehabilitative programs.
* Plan and conduct Residents’ Council meetings.
* Plan and implement evening and weekend functions as necessary.
* Take part in in-service education programs and attend all in-service session relating to Activity Program.
* Recruit, schedule and supervise assistants and volunteers.
* Organize and schedule community events related to residents’ interests.
* Supervise barber and beauty parlor activities.
* Plan, schedule and implement room visits and in-room activities for residents unable to leave their rooms.
* Plan, schedule and implement indoor and outdoor activity programs.
* Plan and conduct activity programs to assist residents to return to the community.
* Maintain an activity attendance record for each resident.
* Assess needs and maintain an adequate supply of materials to implement activity programs.
* Be responsible for the safety of residents under his/her supervision.

  


**Non-Essential Functions****:**

  


* Attends all required training, in-service, and staff meetings.
* Strives to maintain a safe working environment through the prevention of accidents, the preservation of equipment, and the achievement of safe working practices.
* Maintains a positive and professional demeanor toward residents, visitors, families, and co-workers.
* Adheres to all policies and procedures of Spring Hills PASL, LLC
* Performs other duties as assigned

  


**Qualifications/Skills/Educational Requirements****:**


* A Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university; or one to two years related experience and training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Supervisory Experience.
* Basic knowledge and understanding of dementia.
* Exhibits effective approach and communication techniques when interacting with and providing activity programming to people with dementia.
* Exhibits a willingness to learn and to make/accept change as needed or required, and exhibits positive attitude.
* Strong public speaking, planning and organizational skills.
* Demonstrated psycho-social support skills for residents and their families.
* Basic understanding and competence of computer skills, including Microsoft Excel & Word.
* Flexibility to work days, evenings & weekends as required.

  


**Physical Requirements:**



Standing (over 2/3), walking (over 2/3), using hands to finger, handle or feel (over 2/3), reach with hands and arms (over 2/3), climb and balance (over 1/3), stoop, kneel (1/2-2/3), talk or hear (Over 2/3), taste or smell (Over 1/3). Lifting up to 10 pounds (over 2/3), Up to 25 pounds (1/3-2/3); Up to 50 pounds (under 1/3)
